title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.24 - 25 | 8-10-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya Chakshurun Meelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskitya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from two verses.
24th and the 25th verse of the 13th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
The 24th verse
Agnir Nisrishto Dattascha Garodarascha Dushitaha
Hritham Kshetram Dhanam Yesham Tad Dattair Asubhi Kiyat
The meaning of this verse is
There is no need to live a degraded life and subsist on the charity
of the Lord.
There is no need to live a degraded life and subsist on the charity of those whom you tried
to kill by arson and poisoning.
You also insulted one of their wives and usurped their kingdom and wealth.
Vidura is pointing out to Dhritarashtra how Dhritarashtra had done so much of atrocities,
committed so many atrocities against the Pandavas and now living in their house
is a degraded life.
This is a degraded life for Dhritarashtra.
So in the purpose Srila Prabhupada explains some very important points.
The system of Varnashrama religion sets aside a part of one's life
completely for the purpose of self-realization and attainment of salvation
in the human form of life.
This is how the human life is.
The human life is distinguished from animal life.
That there is a special provision that you can set aside a part of your life exclusively
for self-realization, which is the main goal of the human form of life and which is only
possible in the human form of life.
That is a routine division of life.
But persons like Dhritarashtra, even at their very ripened age, want to stay home, even
in a degraded condition of accepting charity from enemies.
Vidura wanted to point this out and impressed upon him that it was better to die like his
Sons than accept such humiliating charity.
It was not a dignified way that Dhritarashtra was living.
It was a dignified way that Dhritarashtra was a living in the heart of that world.
It was not a dignified way that Dhritarashtra was living in the heart of that world.
the house of the Pandavas. So Vidura is pointing out if you have any
consideration for living dignified way you should immediately leave this place.
This is not a suitable place for you. Five thousand years ago there was one
Dhritarashtra but at the present moment there are Dhritarashtras in every
home. People's life has become very degraded in this present time because
they live in spite of all kinds of difficulties and dangers. They don't
make any preparation for facing death like a proper human being.
So that's why Prabhupada says now it's not just one rare Dhritarashtra who is
living a degraded condition of life. There are many many many such people
living a very degraded condition of life and Prabhupada specially mentions here
politicians especially do not retire from political activities unless they're
dragged by the cruel hand of death or killed by some opposing element
We see this all around us. This is the reality. To stick to family life to the end of
one's human life is the grossest type of degradation and there is an absolute
need for the Viduras to educate such Dhritarashtras even at the present moment.
So don't take this episode as some historical incident which is not relevant
now.
It is very much relevant now especially in modern times it's necessary for
saintly persons to wake up the materialistic persons who are lost
engrossed in sense gratification and missing the opportunity of the valuable
human form of life.
The meaning of this 25th verse is despite your unwillingness to die and your desire
to live even at the cost of honor and prestige your miserly body will certainly dwindle
and deteriorate like an old garment.
Somebody may think that I will make some adjustment and somehow live but nature does not allow
you to live in the same way you have been living.
Your body deteriorates and it will give you more and more trouble as the body ages.
It will only deteriorate further.
That's the law of nature.
So in the Parpotriyala Prabhupada says the words Kripanasya Jiji Vishoho are significant
two words Kripana and Jiji Vishoho.
So Prabhupada explains there are two classes of men this is described in the scriptures
in the Upanishads.
This is described.
That are theおい Nosa which means creator and this is explained by Prabhupada here.
One is called Kripana and the other is called Brahmana.
The Kripana or mizerly man has no estimation of his material body but the Brahmana has
a true estimation of himself and material body.
So Kripana and Brahmana.
Kripana does not know the value of this human form of body.
The Brahmana knows the value.
The Kripana, having a wrong estimation of his material body,
wants to enjoy sense gratification with his utmost strength.
And even in old age, he wants to become a young man
by medical treatment or otherwise.
We see this all around us,
that old people somehow want to maintain themselves
for sense gratification,
living a life of sense gratification.
But that's not possible.
That's really not possible.
Dhritarashtra is addressed herein as a Kripana
because without any estimation of his material body,
he wants to live at any cost,
somehow live a life of sense gratification.
Vidura is trying to open his eyes
to see that he cannot live more than his term
and that he must prepare for death.
The symptoms are indicative of fast approaching death
and Dhritarashtra must prepare to face death
like a human being and not miss the opportunity
like an animal.
Since death is inevitable,
why should he accept such a humiliating position for living?
It is better to take the right path
even at the risk of death.
Human life is meant for finishing
all kinds of miseries of material existence.
It's only in the human form of life that this is possible.
It's not possible in animal form of life,
bird form of life, reptile form of life.
The form of life is not possible.
The form of life of lower creatures,
this elevated consciousness does not exist.
There is consciousness in every form of life.
But that consciousness is mainly simply used
for eating, sleeping, mating, defending,
just maintaining the body as far as possible,
subsisting in this material existence.
But human life,
we have got developed consciousness.
For what?
To realize that I can prepare for death
to put an end to all kinds of miseries of material existence.
Life should be so regulated
that one can achieve the desired goal
of going back home, back to Godhead.
Dhritarashtra, due to his wrong conception of life,
had already spoiled 80% of his achieved energy.
So it behooved him to utilize
the remaining days of his miserly life
for the ultimate good.
Such a life is called miserly
because one cannot properly utilize
the assets of the human form of life.
One who does not know the value of this body
will waste this human energy simply for sense gratification.
And at the end, left with nothing, which is, like,
like an asset which one can utilize in the future,
can carry forward to the next life.
So only spiritual assets are eternally with us.
We can carry forward and utilize it always.
Material assets are not going to remain with us.
They will be completely lost at the time of death.
Only by good luck does such a miserly life,
miserly man, meet a self-realized soul like Vidura.
And by his instruction,
by Vidura's instruction,
Dhritarashtra can get rid of the nescience of material existence.
What is nescience?
Nescience means the ignorance,
the darkness in which one is living.
Material existence means there is this ignorance about
who am I?
What is my actual goal of life?
How to solve all the problems of material existence
once and for all?
Make a permanent solution for these problems,
not some temporary patchwork solutions.
No.
So that is possible by meeting a self-realized soul like Vidura
and taking instructions from him
how to actually prepare oneself,
especially towards the end of one's life,
how to prepare for facing death
by spiritual culture,
by spiritual practice,
by spiritual enlightenment.
And especially in this age,
it has been simplified
to the maximum extent possible
by Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu,
who very mercifully is pointing out
that you can very easily
vibrate your tongue in any condition.
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
and simply by vibrating the tongue
and chanting this Hare Krishna mantra
and also hearing this mantra,
so then the consciousness becomes transformed into
spiritual consciousness, Krishna consciousness,
and thereby preparing oneself to face death
in touch with Krishnanama,
the holy name,
the merciful incarnation of the Supreme Lord Krishna
in the form of his holy name.
Simply by vibrating the tongue
and hearing the sound of Hare Krishna,
you can prepare for facing death
in such a way that
you keep on vibrating your tongue,
chanting and hearing Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
and you actually
are able to
go back to Godhead at the end of this life.
Simply by doing this and nothing more.
That is Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's mercy.
I'll stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
